definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Japan's new government Poodle or Pekinese?
sentences.chinese: 日本新政府到底是狮子狗还是京巴？

sentences.english: The Poodle, the Pom, the Alsatian.
sentences.chinese: 狮子狗，博美狗，阿尔萨斯。

sentences.english: I don't want my picture taken walking in the park with her poodle.
sentences.chinese: 我不想被拍到在公园和她的狮子狗在散步。

sentences.english: The only animals you see in the streets are pet pekinese .
sentences.chinese: 路上唯一看得见的动物是宠物狮子狗。

sentences.english: The Poodle and the Shih Tzu completed the top 10.
sentences.chinese: 同时跻身前十名的还有狮子狗和西施犬。

sentences.english: And we're all over that farm, this little poodle and me.
sentences.chinese: 我们在农场，小狮子狗和我。

sentences.english: When I took the Shih-Tzu out, the Collie jumped and scratched at the door.
sentences.chinese: 我牵出狮子狗的时候，长毛牧羊犬跳起来狠狠地抓门。

definition: same as Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子 (369-286 BC), Daoist author
Ox-Head, one of the two guardians of the underworld in Chinese mythology
Lu Ban, legendary master craftsman, called the father of Chinese carpentry
Houyi, mythological Chinese archer whose wife was Chang'e
leech/bloodsucking vermin/vampire (translated European notion)/fig. cruel exploiter, esp. a capitalist exploiting the workers
